Control.Text: Don't count "Encounter" labeled encounters for this count.
Cull old encounters when there are this many normal encounters total:
Cull normal encounters created longer than this many minutes ago:
Cull other encounters from previous zones this many ago:
Cull the "All" encounter from this many zones ago:
Hide Mini Parse on application restore
Align text to appear in columns based on cell contents
Allow mouse clicks to pass through.
Minimize application to Mini Parse window
Number of seconds to wait after the last combat action to pause the encounter duration:
Show thousand separators in the Main tab tables
Reverse the sorting order of the main table. (Decending order)
Main table update frequency in seconds:
Number of seconds to wait after the last combat action to begin a new encounter:
Use an internal timer to count down instead of relying only on logfile timestamps.
Simple bar graphs depicting the current sort.
Advanced DPS over time graphs. (CPU Intensive)
In Graphs, simplify numbers to use K/M/B suffixes
For line graphs, set the plot points to include the average of the last N seconds:
DamageType categories to include in combatant line graphs.
Graph lines show a rolling average instead of grouped together segments of time

When connected to the ACT Clipboard Sharer(get it from the ACT website), whenever text is exported by ACT to the clipboard, it is sent to the connected computer's clipboard. This allows you to run ACT over the network and still paste data into the game. Also usable for G15/G19 data.
This feature is for users running ACT on a different machine than the game.
For text exports, filter out combatants with spaces in their name. (Possible swarm pets)
Export to EQ2 Macro File after combat.
Maximum number of lines to attempt to export
Align text to appear in columns based on cell contents
Export a table of the current encounter every N seconds.
Export down to specific swings (large DB req)
Send one row per INSERT statement. (Debug/MSSQL)
Export data to an ODBC DB after combat
Automatically cull the number of listed encounters to a specified amount:
Send EQ2 HTML files to FTP server
Set EQ2 homepage and/or replace UI
Every second generate a Timers Window HTML page
Generate a graph of the current encounter.
Export static HTML files to view with /browser
Desired size in pixels of the HTML graph images.
Text to Speech Control Panel Applet
Require the UI thread for playing sounds
Use WMP API Sound (Volume control, multiple sounds, slight latency)
Use Windows API Sound (No volume control, one sound at a time)
Allow these settings to affect plugin tabs
(Only adjusts colors not defined in this area)
Draw shading over the TreeView/DataGrid scrollbars
Custom Trigger parsing may spawn up to this many additional threads:
CPU Priority of normal log parsing:
Disable incremental caching for data objects
Scan ACT folders and plugins for Internet downloads to unblock.
When opening or closing log files, attempt to rename the log if over this value (in megabytes):
No log file selected. (Remember to turn /log ON)
Once a minute, automatically save ACT's Encounter History Database.
Once a minute, automatically save ACT's settings.
Immediately attempt to free all unused memory from RAM when clearing encounters (may freeze ACT)
Minimize ACT to a tray icon.
Record all log lines while parsing. (View Logs context menu option)
Populate an 'All' encounter which includes all data from separate encounters within a zone. (Not retroactive)
Only populate the 'All' entry for DamageType categories except those marked (Ref). (Not retroactive)
Convert Config XML to XML Share Snippet
No selective parsing (Rely on automatic ally detection)
Show only listed combatants in graphs/text exports
Only record combat actions taken by/against listed
In "allied" totals, only include listed players
Default character name if not defined by the log file name.
When calculating average delay, group together multiple hits in a single second. (More accurate)
Count a hit that inflicts no damage as a Hit in calculations.
For text export durations, include wall-time while in-combat.
Allow heals to extend an encounter's duration past the last damage action.
Rename a combatant to a new one, or merge into an old one
Redirect damage done by a specific ability name into a combatant
Browse to select a plugin file...
When importing by time, don't stop importing until end of combat
When importing, parse for Custom Triggers (tabbed results only)
When the imported file includes log text, parse it for Custom Triggers (tabbed results only)
When exporting, include the log lines found in the View Logs feature
Desired size in pixels of the HTML graph images.
Export with these options to HTML...
Export all tables of the selected encounter
Export from the main table to the DamageType data tables
Export only the main table data
Delete history older than a specified amount:
If checked, ACT will save session records to file and load them on start-up. Enabling this feature will automatically load a previously saved database file.

Search results will have bold dates in the calendar.
Selecting a date or range in the calendar, or an entry in the Search results will select that Date/Time range with the pickers.
Type comments here, then click Submit.

If you wish to send a private message regarding the main ACT program, feel free to use this submission form. Plugins that I did not author, I may not be able to help with.
If you want a prompt response, I strongly suggest using the ACT website forums or email. Find links above.
Include error logs from "Advanced Combat Tracker.log"
